chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric L. Kimble was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.  A payment plan can be set up with the Clerk's Of Courts for those assessments, fees and surcharges. If payments are not made, a civil judgement, with interest, may be ordered.
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent. Shall not consume or possess any controlled substances.  May take prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages. DNA sample unless already done.

Court advises the deft as to his rights to a preliminary hearing  FVI  Deft enters a plea of guilty to Count 2, Count 1 is DRI.  Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.
